description: Construction of single storey outbuilding with habitable roof space (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings titled:

A695/L1A Location Plan; A695/L2 1875 Map of Bedford Park; A695/PM01 Existing Garden Plan; A695/PM02 Existing Street Elevation; A695/PM03 Existing Site Elevations; A695/PL01D Proposed Studio Roof and Garden Plan; A695/PL02C Proposed Street Elevation; A695/PL03D Proposed Site Elevations; A695/PL04D Proposed Studio Plans and Elevations; A695/PL20A Box Framed Sash Window Joinery; A695/PL21A Hinged Doors Joinery Details; A695/PL23 Velux Conservation Rooflight; Arboricultural Survey & Impact Assessment (ref: AIA/MF/0145/21-A); Heritage, Design & Access Statement
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The outbuilding permitted shall only be used for incidental purposes to the enjoyment of no. 7 Woodstock Road, W4 1DS, and not for any ancillary annex, separate residential use or for any industrial, commercial or business use.  No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
